alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 11:56AM CST until February 16 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND RIO GRANDE VALLEY... .A cold front has brought low humidity and gusty northwest winds this morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid and erratic spread of wildfires. Conditions will improve after sunset with diminishing winds and cooling temperatures. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR ZAPATA, JIM HOGG, AND STARR COUNTIES... * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, and Starr. * TIMING...Until 5 PM. * WINDS...North 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
